intro: Acrostichum stigmatolepis, commonly known as the narrow-leaf fern, is a tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is characterized by its delicate, finely divided fronds. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks. Its rhizomes are often used in traditional medicine, and it can reach heights of up to 1 meter. The leaves are usually dark green and have a leathery texture, contributing to its ornamental value.
